introduction: In this video, the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) is explained, focusing on its importance in real-life scenarios, particularly in entrepreneurship and startups. The video covers the planning, design, estimation, implementation, testing, and maintenance phases of the SDLC, with real-life examples and practical applications.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to SDLC
content: Explanation of SDLC and its significance in real-life scenarios.
Discussion on the two entities involved in SDLC: customer and service provider.
Overview of the different phases of SDLC.
Introduction to the importance of systematic approaches in software development.

sections.title: Section 2: Planning Phase
content: Explanation of the planning phase and its importance in SDLC.
Discussion on customer requirements and service provider estimation work.
Overview of different estimation methods like COCOMO and Line of Code Function Point.
Real-life examples of estimation and negotiation in the planning phase.

sections.title: Section 3: Designing Phase
content: Explanation of the designing phase and its importance in SDLC.
Discussion on cohesion, coupling, functions, and modules in software design.
Overview of different design methodologies like DFD and UML.
Real-life examples of design in various platforms and technologies.

sections.title: Section 4: Implementation and Testing Phases
content: Explanation of the implementation and testing phases and their importance in SDLC.
Discussion on the testing process and its impact on project success.
Overview of different testing methodologies and techniques.
Real-life examples of testing and maintenance in software development.

sections.title: Section 5: Maintenance and Deployment Phases
content: Explanation of the maintenance and deployment phases and their importance in SDLC.
Discussion on the annual or monthly maintenance charges and their impact on software development.
Overview of different deployment strategies and tools.
Real-life examples of maintenance and deployment in software development.
